answers: Someone who intentionally releases top secret information via computer or other electronic means
Someone who accidentally discloses protected information by storing it in the "cloud"
Someone who copies protected information to a flash drive and gives it to the press
All of the above
questions.prompt: Which of these would not be considered a cyber insider threat?

answers: There is no difference
Insider threats don't use electronic means to steal information
We voluntarily trust the insider threat with access
Insider threats are more easily captured
questions.prompt: What is the fundamental difference between a cyber insider threat and a hacker?

answers: An insider's use of a co-workers credentials
An insider's use of IT for the unauthorized modification, addition, or deletion of an organization's data
Modification of an organization's data by an authorized insider
Addition, or deletion of an organization's data by a trusted insider without approval by the IT supervisor
questions.prompt: Which of these best defines Insider Fraud?

answers: Most saboteurs had common personal predispositions that contributed to the risk of committing malicious acts.
Stressful events including organizational sanctions and unmet expectations, contribute to the likelihood of insider IT sabotage.
Suspicious behaviors were often observable before and during insider IT sabotage and espionage.
All of the above
questions.prompt: Which of the following are true statements about insider sabotage?

answers: Alcohol and drug addictions, physical spousal abuse, panic attacks, diagnosed mental health issues
Insecurity, bullying, sensitivity to criticism, sense of entitlement, lack of impulse control, and self-esteem deficits
Conflicts with co-workers, hygiene problems, extreme shyness, bullying, petty theft, misuse of resources, falsifying of information, violations of office policies
All of the above
questions.prompt: Which of these are common traits of IT Insider Threats?

title: You've landed on Cyber Insider Threat.
